head.title: Does a Missile Shield Make Sense?

hedline.hl1: Does a Missile Shield Make Sense?

abstract.p: Joseph A Tenaglia letter on missile defense proposals says he does not want his children to be helplessin face of threats from any country that can muster even one intercontinental ballistic misile to fire against US (S)

block.p: Re ''The Poseurs of Missile Defense,'' by Frances FitzGerald (Op-Ed, June 4):

The policy of mutual assured destruction was forced on us because of a relentless arms race with a superpower in which missile technology outpaced defensive systems. Our country's security requires our best scientific and diplomatic solutions, not a return to MAD.
Re ''The Poseurs of Missile Defense,'' by Frances FitzGerald (Op-Ed, June 4):

The policy of mutual assured destruction was forced on us because of a relentless arms race with a superpower in which missile technology outpaced defensive systems. Our country's security requires our best scientific and diplomatic solutions, not a return to MAD.

I, for one, do not want my children to be helpless in the face of threats from North Korea, Iran, Libya or any other country that can muster the resources to threaten us with even one intercontinental ballistic missile. The price we may have to pay to prevent such a catastrophe would be truly small in comparison.
JOSEPH A. TENAGLIA Sea Girt, N.J., June 4, 2000
